content.description: The route starts by manteling on the pig snout block. Climb left and out the small roof. A little zesty around the third and fourth bolt. Make it to the ledge rest then balance your way up slopers to the top.
content.location: Look for the pig snout block.

content.description: A fun, steep and varied route with roofy jugs, a distinct midway crux, and thoughtful climbing up high. Stick clip the high first bolt. Start off the "snout", a protruding block 5' off the ground. Thug out jugs and heel hooks through a blocky overhang. Bust through a thinner crux on sidepulls or smaller holds. Swing into the jug-crack of a big hanging block, then mantle over for a rest. Continue up steep interesting climbing to the top. While it eases off somewhat, keep some fuel in the tank. The top is wet during seepy season, so give it a gander from the ground before you embark.
content.location: Right of Will Feral, also starts on pig snout block.

content.description: Boulder problem down low, then the climbing eases up until pulling the bulge at the top.
content.location: Route twenty feet right on Piggly Wiggly.

content.description: Thoughtful face climbing on edges and ledges lead to a crux pull to surmount a bulge. Navigate this with edges and maybe a hidden undercling. Jug it out on flat edges to the finish. Can be seepy during the wetter season so catch it if it's dry.
content.location: Next route right of Birthday Arete.

content.description: Excellent route with sequential, bouldery climbing. Onsight spoilers ahead: this one features some memorable brick-like pinches, punchy roof cruxes, and a heartbreaker crux. Start off the ground at a blunt arete and tech up some subtle holds to gain jugs--or start from right jugs up a bit and swing in left. Now, boulder your way through a sequential set of squeezy pinches and heel hooks, to pop to an edge--awesome!--then chug some hard moves over the 'hang to a little breather. Navigate sculpted holds and long pulls through a little corner-bulge, and try to gain another squatty stance. Fight your way through crimps and slimps to the end.
content.protection: Quickdraws. A doubled QD or shoulder-length draw may be good for both drag and better clipping in one or two spots.
content.location: Next route right of Snout Route.

content.description: Overhung corner/crack system to big moves. Once past the powerful low boulder problem, continue up the blocky arete to the chains.
content.location: Far right side of Pig Wall, left of a chimney system.

content.description: Prime face climbing leads to roof pull. Save some gusto for the top run to the chains!
content.location: Right end of Pig Wall, a few routes right of the pig snout block.

climbs.name: Boom Shaka (aka Gifford the Big Red Dog)

content.description: Start beneath a small roof with strong moves that climbs straight up to sustained face climbing.
content.location: Far right end of the Pig Wall.

content.description: This route follows up the arete
content.location: On the far left of Pig Wall.

content.description: Beautiful orange and black sandstone offering some fun lines. Named for the pig snout looking block wedged low on the right side of the wall.
